pullrequest.title: Update the style of collapsible items

content.raw:
I believe the current implementation of `MessageWidget` is essentially a tree view with properties:

* Items collapse
* Elements are indented according to their depth

I'm not saying there isn't room for improvement for the looks and interaction, but I *strongly* believe just throwing away all nested structures would be a mistake.

I'm taking a look at other pieces of software, for example [Unreal's world outliner](https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Engine/UI/LevelEditor/SceneOutliner/#searchingtheworld), [Unity's inspectors](https://unity3d.com/ru/unity/whats-new/unity-5.1), [Blender's scene hierarchy](https://answers.unrealengine.com/storage/attachments/36841-root.png) - nested properties are everywhere and they serve a good purpose of allowing a high level quick introspection. By no means that should be the only interface, but I believe it is an essential one to the kind of software we're writing.
